system.name: TORI
system.summary: Governed AI-native operating framework for bounded, auditable model-assisted work.
system.ip_notice: TORI is a compositional system; value derives from integration + sequencing across components, not any single file.

components.intent: Defines system-wide guarantees, allowed capabilities, and fail-closed behavior.
Classifies requests into controlled paths (informational, analytical, operational) and denies/defers high-risk trajectories.
Applies constraints: least privilege, data minimization, escalation rules, and tool-use boundaries.
Defines data classification, redaction requirements, retention constraints, and provenance expectations.
Specifies what is logged, how decisions are attributable, and how audits and incident reviews are supported.
Harm-limiting model: predictable defaults, misuse resistance, uncertainty handling, and escalation/shutdown triggers.
Enumerates boundaries, failure modes, and explicit shutdown conditions for safe operation.
Defines how TORI changes are proposed, reviewed, versioned, validated, and rolled back.

artifacts.purpose: System definition and scope; non-goals; anti-theft framing.
Canonical ledger of components, versions, and ownership.
Architecture, operating principles, and control flow at a high level.
Safety model, harm-limiting controls, and misuse reduction.
Explicit boundaries, failure modes, and shutdown conditions.
Audit model, version semantics, approval gates, and rollback strategy.

consistency.naming: All component IDs use the tori.<domain>.<name> convention.
consistency.versioning: Single system version; component versions align unless explicitly diverged in future releases.
consistency.ip_notice: All documents must state TORI is compositional and not replicable from a single file.
